intro: Elatostema hastatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf false shamrock, is a herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettles and related plants. The plant features small, heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive waxy coating that helps reduce water loss. Its flowers are tiny, greenish-white, and clustered in dense inflorescences. Elatostema hastatum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions.
